subject: p14727722
Findings: Frontal radiograph of the chest. Compared to the prior study, the patient has been extubated. There is no change in the right internal jugular central venous catheter. Enteric tube has been removed. Marked cardiomegaly is unchanged with pericardial effusion noted on recent CT. Widened mediastinum is unchanged. Degree of bilateral pulmonary vascular congestion and increased interstitial markings indicative of pulmonary edema is unchanged. Left lower lobe ateleftasis or pneumonia, opacity.
Impression: Interval extubation and removal of enteric tube with unchanged severe cardiomegaly, moderate pericardial effusion, and moderate pulmonary edema.
